ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I really grew in my knowledge of political theory. I enjoyed the formal theory more, but the greatest growth for me was in normative political theory.
I learned about works of political philosophy I had previously not encountered and was brought up to date on the current work in distributive justice.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Really enjoyed the structure of the course. There weren't any significant weaknesses. The homework problem sets were fantastic, almost fun to solve.

I enjoyed the lectures but I wish the professor engaged the class in discussion more often. I often prepared questions that were simply answered directly by the professor. I particularly enjoyed our dinner because it allowed for a wider discussion of the course's subject matter.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely. It was great to see how formal theory could be used to critique and develop normative political theory.
Yes, Professor Roemer is an expert in the subject and it is well taught.
